intro: Huperzia heterocarpos, commonly known as the variegated huperzia, is a species of moss-like plant belonging to the family Huperziaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to brownish foliage. The plant produces sporophytes with elongated, cylindrical sporangia that are typically clustered at the base of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories across tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
